text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The response explicitly addresses the requirement of the criterion. In Section 4.4, it discusses the Anti-Suit Injunction (ASI) and states: 'English courts can grant an ASI to restrain the German distributor from pursuing parallel proceedings, provided the arbitration agreement is valid and the claim falls within its scope.' It further cites the legal basis under the Arbitration Act 1996 s. 9(2) and relevant case law, which directly relates to the obligation of courts (in this case, English courts, given the London seat) to enforce the arbitration agreement by staying or dismissing parallel actions, consistent with the principles of the New York Convention Art. II(3) and the English Arbitration Act section 9.", "criterion_id": "9a18bff1-0b8a-437e-b610-22df6d1367a6"}
